thread.title: Read the 9th Circuit judges' order: 'Emergency motion ... is denied'
thread.title_full: Read the 9th Circuit judges' order: 'Emergency motion ... is denied'

title: Read the 9th Circuit judges' order: 'Emergency motion ... is denied'
text:
Live updates: 9th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals rules against Trump and travel ban will not go into effect Feb. 9, 2017, 3:44 p.m. 
The U.S. 9th Circuit Court of Appeals has ruled to continue blocking enforcement of President Trump ’s travel ban. The unanimous decision means that a stay preventing a ban on on immigration from seven predominantly Muslim countries remains in place, at least for now. The ruling came after the three-judge panel heard arguments this week from the Justice Department and Washington state. 9th Circuit Court upholds stay 
Earlier this week: President Trump's words on Muslims come back to bite him. Judges ask about limiting parts of the travel ban, rather than blocking it entirely. Meet the three judges deciding whether to reinstate Trump's travel ban. Read Trump's executive order and legal filings for and against the executive order. Ruling Feb. 9, 2017, 3:39 p.m. Read the 9th Circuit judges' order: 'Emergency motion ... is denied' 
“We hold that the Government has not shown a likelihood of success on the merits of its appeal, nor has it shown that failure to enter a stay would cause irreparable injury,” the panel of two Democratic appointees and a Republican unanimously decided in an unsigned opinion.
